content:
• Friday, July 27, 2012
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +30.2%) +15.7% AH to $8.19, adding to the big gains it saw today on reports...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +30.2%) +15.7% AH to $8.19, adding to the big gains it saw today on reports (I, II) Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) is planning to buy the company at a price near $15/share. The question speculators are fighting over: is Seagate actually desperate enough to improve its solid-state drive (SSD) position (necessary given the long-term threat posed by SSDs) that it would pay a ~50% premium relative to OCZ's all-time high, in spite of many alternatives? STEC gained 6.9% on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon's (AMZN +7.9%) Q2 results helped Groupon (GRPN +14.8%) in more ways than one. Found...

    Amazon's (AMZN +7.9%) Q2 results helped Groupon (GRPN +14.8%) in more ways than one. Found within Amazon's 10-Q for the quarter is the news that top Groupon rival LivingSocial, in which Amazon has a 31% stake, posted Q2 revenue of $138M (+133% Y/Y), and an operating loss of $96M. Groupon is currently expected to generate Q2 revenue of $578M, and an operating profit of $73M. (more on AMZN) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • FURX

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (FURX +5.5%) ramped higher into the close after confirming that Takeda...

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (FURX +5.5%) ramped higher into the close after confirming that Takeda Pharmaceutical (TKPYY.PK) has resubmitted New Drug Applications to the FDA for alogliptin and fixed-dose combination therapy alogliptin and pioglitazone for treating adult type 2 diabetes. Under it's agreement with Takeda, FURX is eligible to receive a $25M milestone payment for the approval of the first of these two NDAs, as well as additonal royalties and sales-based milestones.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia's (EXPE +20.1%) stellar Q2 report, which featured a 22% Y/Y jump in hotel bookings,...

    Expedia's (EXPE +20.1%) stellar Q2 report, which featured a 22% Y/Y jump in hotel bookings, ended up fueling a strong rally in online travel stocks. PCLN +8.9%. OWW +7.3%. TZOO +4.9%. KYAK +2.8%. During its earnings call, Expedia guided for low double-digit 2012 revenue growth (consensus is for 10.6%) and high single-digit EBITDA growth. Still, Pac Crest is on edge over comments about weakening Southern European demand, and Deutsche thinks Priceline is a better buy. (Q1 rally)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • STX

    Bright Side of News reports that Seagate's (STX -0.2%) purchase of OCZ Technology (OCZ +29%) is...

    Bright Side of News reports that Seagate's (STX -0.2%) purchase of OCZ Technology (OCZ +29%) is a done deal. The sale has already been agreed to, according to its sources close to the negotiations, and may be announced when STX reports its Q2 results on July 30. One source is pegging the deal at around $1.14B.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NYSE:NS) +1.5% after reporting Q2 results that included adjusted net income...

    NuStar Energy (NYSE:NS) +1.5% after reporting Q2 results that included adjusted net income applicable to limited partners of $0.06/unit vs. $1.34/unit in the year-ago period. CEO Curt Anastasio says NS is in the midst of "house cleaning" as it switches gears to increase its fee-based pipeline and terminaling operations and cut back exposure to asphalt.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • GDOT

    Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan both pile on to the Green Dot (GDOT -60%) party-bashing, cutting the...

    Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan both pile on to the Green Dot (GDOT -60%) party-bashing, cutting the shares respectively to Hold and Neutral amid a gloomy forecast by the company on the prepaid market. Deutsche says the company's model has "broken down," in the face of increased competition and greater risk/compliance costs, while JPMorgan calls into question management's credibility in the face of such a significant cut to numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • ACW

    Commercial vehicle component supplier Accuride (ACW +11%) trades up today, shaking off Q2 losses...

    Commercial vehicle component supplier Accuride (ACW +11%) trades up today, shaking off Q2 losses that missed both top and bottom-line Street estimates late yesterday. Investors appear to be focused on the companys improved FY12 forecast. It says that despite near-term commercial vehicle market weakness, it expects to see a smaller loss ranging from $0.12 - $0.05 per share on revenues of $1B - $1.03B. Analysts are looking for an EPS of $0.17 on revenues of $1.02B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.1%) is bouncing strongly today. One possible reason is the top-line...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.1%) is bouncing strongly today. One possible reason is the top-line beat found in contract manufacturer Celestica's (CLS +6.8%) Q2 report. Celestica is winding down its RIM business, but that only started in Q3. In Q2, RIM made up 17% of Celestica's sales. That's down slightly from Q1's 19%, but probably better than some feared. Hopefully for RIM, this won't lead the company to be burdened with more excess inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +6%) says it's increasing current spot market base prices for all carbon...

    AK Steel (AKS +6%) says it's increasing current spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products by $40 per ton, effective immediately with new orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • AET

    Aetna (AET +2.7%) authorizes an additional $750M to its buyback program, in addition to the...

    Aetna (AET +2.7%) authorizes an additional $750M to its buyback program, in addition to the approximately $248M of repurchase authority currently available under it's existing authorization as of June 30. The company intends to continue buying shares in the open market as necessary. AET has been active over the past quarter, having had approximately $828M of repurchase authority still left available as of March 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -5.5%) CEO Richard O'Brien warns in his conference call that further...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -5.5%) CEO Richard O'Brien warns in his conference call that further protests and social unrest around the $5B Conga gold mine project in Peru could delay development work. NEM continues to work with Peru's government and supports Pres. Humala's social inclusion plan, O'Brien says, but further development will occur "only with local and national support."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • N

    Cloud ERP software vendor NetSuite (N +17.5%) soars to all-time highs after beating Q2...

    Cloud ERP software vendor NetSuite (N +17.5%) soars to all-time highs after beating Q2 estimates, and guiding on its earnings call for 2012 revenue of $300M-$305M and EPS of $0.21-$0.22 (consensus is for $300.2M and $0.21). Deferred revenue rose 8% Q/Q and 38% Y/Y to $130M, and the company's average deal size rose 29% Y/Y to over $50K. Canaccord is reiterating a Hold due to NetSuite's steep valuation. CRM +6.4%. CSOD +4.1%. KNXA +5.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • RUTH

    Ruth's Hospitality Group (RUTH +16.5%) trades up after easily beating Q2 revenue estimates....

    Ruth's Hospitality Group (RUTH +16.5%) trades up after easily beating Q2 revenue estimates. Comparable sales at its company-owned Ruth's Chris Steak House brand rose 6%, while sales at its Mitchell's Fish Market increased 2.3%. Worth noting: this is the ninth consecutive quarter of comparable sales growth and 10th straight period of traffic growth at Ruth's Chris.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +13.6%) has had quite the roller-coaster ride over the last two days....

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +13.6%) has had quite the roller-coaster ride over the last two days. Shares crashed yesterday after it was learned the SEC had contacted Ubiquiti about distributor Flytec's cash movements and sales to Iran. However, shares of the company, which had 46.7% of its float shorted on July 13, are rebounding strongly today. Ubiquiti is no stranger to controversy (I, II, III).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -10.6%) recoups some of its early losses, as analysts stay loyal following the...

    Facebook (FB -10.6%) recoups some of its early losses, as analysts stay loyal following the company's Q2 report (this wasn't the case with Zynga). Topeka Capital is focusing on Facebook's rising ARPUs and Sponsored Stories success, and Goldman now thinks ad CPMs will grow 10% this year and 13% in 2013. However, Barclays doesn't like the lack of 2H guidance, and Capstone remains worried (previous) about slowing growth in Facebook's most lucrative markets. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • TMUS

    Like Sprint, MetroPCS (PCS +4.7%) is rising on an upgrade a day after soaring thanks to a...

    Like Sprint, MetroPCS (PCS +4.7%) is rising on an upgrade a day after soaring thanks to a positive earnings report. Deutsche's reasons for lifting PCS to Buy: it thinks new 4G devices can produce a "sharper than anticipated return" to subscriber and ARPU growth; it believes the company has several "strategic alternatives," such as spectrum deals and a buyout; and shares trade at a 30% discount to larger peers. Leap Wireless (LEAP +7.5%) is also rallying.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • BCOR

    Blucora (BCOR +25%) jumps after its Q2 swung to a profit and the company forecast strong growth...

    Blucora (BCOR +25%) jumps after its Q2 swung to a profit and the company forecast strong growth in the current quarter, as the company's web search business improved substantially and its prior-year period was weighed down by the sale of an underperforming business. Benchmark says investors don't fully get the "Blucora story." The company has strong operating momentum, growing cash flow and a solid balance sheet. The firm reiterates a Buy on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • NOK

    With some help from rising European markets, Nokia (NOK +4.2%) has quietly rallied 23% this...

    With some help from rising European markets, Nokia (NOK +4.2%) has quietly rallied 23% this week, as value investors bet the company can stabilize. A Chinese site recently reported that Nokia will unveil two Windows Phone 8 models (previous) at its Sep. 5 Nokia World event. There are already hints Nokia WP8 devices could go on sale soon afterwards. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 27 Comments
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -11.7%) crashes for the second day in a row (previous) thanks to a column from SA's...

    VirnetX (VHC -11.7%) crashes for the second day in a row (previous) thanks to a column from SA's Special K that questioned both the company's ability to prevail in its patent disputes with Apple and Cisco, and its ability to receive a huge payoff if it does. Shares are now down 24% over the last two days. Today's drop comes even as Gilford Securities defends VirnetX, arguing the company's ITC case remains on track in spite of a recent delay.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • LM

    Shares of Legg Mason (LM -2%) swing lower after the company missed FQ1 estimates this morning....

    Shares of Legg Mason (LM -2%) swing lower after the company missed FQ1 estimates this morning. The asset manager posted double-digit revenue declines amid a smaller pool of assets under management and continued outflows of investor cash. The company has struggled with a dwindling asset base due to poor performance, having not seen any net inflows of investor funds since 2007.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +8.3%) and eBay (EBAY +2.7%) rally in the wake of Amazon's market-pleasing Q2...

    Groupon (GRPN +8.3%) and eBay (EBAY +2.7%) rally in the wake of Amazon's market-pleasing Q2 report. Amazon's strong sales of 3rd-party merchandise, much of which is sold by small businesses, might be especially going over well. Groupon is heavily shorted, and has been bludgeoned in recent weeks on a litany of worries, as well as poor analyst commentary.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • KEG

    Key Energy (KEG +10.7%) shares surge after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.21, beating consensus...

    Key Energy (KEG +10.7%) shares surge after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.21, beating consensus estimates by $0.02, on revenues of $516M, up 24.5% Y/Y and in line with estimates. For Q3, KEG foresees revenues increasing ~4% Q/Q driving a 20%-25% gain in operating income.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +6.9%) may have missed Q2 estimates and reported subscriber losses, but its...

    Clearwire (CLWR +6.9%) may have missed Q2 estimates and reported subscriber losses, but its guidance for a smaller-than-expected EBITDA loss is helping its beaten-down shares rally today; Clearwire is now up 20% since partner Sprint issued its Q2 report yesterday. During its earnings call, Clearwire reiterated its plans to launch its TD-LTE 4G network by June 2013, and also talked up the value of its spectrum in light of recent activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • GT

    U.S. tire makers Goodyear (GT +5.2%) and Cooper (CTB +5%) are big gainers, driven by France's...

    U.S. tire makers Goodyear (GT +5.2%) and Cooper (CTB +5%) are big gainers, driven by France's Michelin, which reaffirms its 2012 financial targets after posting 37% H1 growth in its local earnings; volumes were down, but pricing was higher. Drivers apparently are still buying new tires even if they may not be buying new cars as readily as before.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S +5.2%) adds to yesterday's big post-earnings gains after receiving an upgrade to Buy...

    Sprint (S +5.2%) adds to yesterday's big post-earnings gains after receiving an upgrade to Buy from UBS. Also, Nomura is lifting its estimates today: the firm says it's encouraged by declining subscriber support costs, and Sprint's ability to hold onto 60% of Nextel customers, as it shuts down Nextel's ancient iDEN network.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA +8.6%) and Qlik (QLIK +17.4%), bid up on big data hype and hammered due to...

    Informatica (INFA +8.6%) and Qlik (QLIK +17.4%), bid up on big data hype and hammered due to earnings warnings (I, II) partly stemming from heavy European exposure, are surging after posting Q2 results (I, II) and issuing soothing guidance. Informatica expects 2012 revenue of $812M-$832M and EPS of $1.45 (consensus is for $822M and $1.44), and Qlik expects 2012 revenue of $376M-$378M and EPS of $0.31-$0.35 (consensus is for $377.3M and $0.34.). MSTR +3.4%. TIBX +5.3%. (INFA transcript) (QLIK transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL +1.7%) discloses it is conducting internal investigations of compliance with...

    Halliburton (HAL +1.7%) discloses it is conducting internal investigations of compliance with certain company policies in its operations in Angola and Iraq. In a meeting with the DOJ and SEC regarding a previous investigation, HAL advised the agencies it was initiating unrelated investigations into payments made to third-party agents relating to customs and visa matters.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • CERN

    Cerner (CERN -6%) slips after posting a Q2 report that beat on the bottom line, but forecasting...

    Cerner (CERN -6%) slips after posting a Q2 report that beat on the bottom line, but forecasting gloomy Q3 guidance. Net earnings rose 36% as the hospital-information technology vendor saw revenue jump in both its main segments, led by system sales. For the current quarter, Cerner expects earnings between $0.57 and $0.59 on revenue of $635M to $655M. Street expectations are for an EPS of $0.59 on revenue of $652M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +6.5%) makes new 52-week highs a day after after reporting largely in-line Q2...

    3D Systems (DDD +6.5%) makes new 52-week highs a day after after reporting largely in-line Q2 results, and re-affirming its 2012 guidance. Needham is out with a bullish report today: the firm praises 3D's margin expansion, strong top-line growth, and healthy European performance. During its earnings call, the company said early orders for its Cube home 3D printer have topped expectations, though it doesn't expect a major near-term impact. Rival SSYS +3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -18.4%) crumbles yet again after announcing Qualcomm CEO Paul Jacobs has...

    A123 Systems (AONE -18.4%) crumbles yet again after announcing Qualcomm CEO Paul Jacobs has resigned from the company's board, supposedly to focus more on his day job. But it might just be that investors are looking for a reason to sell in light of A123's perilous financial position.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +5.4%) is now up strongly post-earnings, as worries about top-line weakness and...

    Amazon (AMZN +5.4%) is now up strongly post-earnings, as worries about top-line weakness and aggressive spending get overshadowed by a rising gross margin. Growing sales of e-books, AWS server/storage capacity, and third-party merchandise (now 40% of unit sales) are contributing to the margin gains. Goldman thinks these trends will lead to Amazon's operating margin bottoming later this year, and reaching 3.7% in 2013. Nomura (previous) also forecasts rising margins. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 10 Comments
  • CSX

    CSX (CSX +1.6%) moves higher following CEO Michael Ward's sit-down with Jim Cramer. Ward says...

    CSX (CSX +1.6%) moves higher following CEO Michael Ward's sit-down with Jim Cramer. Ward says U.S. coal shipments have slumped 33% from last year to 1M carloads in 2012, but 80% of its other industries are either stable or improving, including lumber, which is closely tied to housing development. Auto shipments are up 27%; chemicals, nat gas and oil shipments also up.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT -60%) get slammed after missing Q2 earnings estimates across the board...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT -60%) get slammed after missing Q2 earnings estimates across the board late yesterday. Net profit slipped 1.5% on weaker margins. The company also lowered FY12 guidance, citing uncertainty in the prepaid market. It now expects an EPS between $1.29 and $1.32 on revenue in a range of $534M to $543M. Wedbush, Jefferies and Sterne Agee all downgrade the shares on the back of the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • AUTH

    AuthenTec (AUTH +62.8%) is trading at $8.25, 3% above Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) $8/share buyout...

    AuthenTec (AUTH +62.8%) is trading at $8.25, 3% above Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) $8/share buyout price. Speculators appear to be betting a higher bid will arrive from Google, Samsung, or some other party interested in keeping AuthenTec's fingerprint sensor and mobile VPN solutions out of Apple's hands. Larry Dignan thinks Apple's purchase is all about staying ahead of Samsung and Android in the enterprise, as IT's "bring your own device" trend continues afoot.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX -11.7%) continues to get roasted after missing FQ3 estimates, guiding FQ4 and...

    Starbucks (SBUX -11.7%) continues to get roasted after missing FQ3 estimates, guiding FQ4 and FY13 forecasts lower, and making downbeat comments on its earnings call about U.S. traffic (slowdown in June), EMEA demand (flat same-store sales), and K-Cup margins. Baird is downgrading Starbucks to Neutral, but Deutsche thinks accelerating unit growth, ongoing same-store sales growth, and lower commodity prices spell a buying opportunity. GMCR -1.3%. DNKN -1.3%. JVA -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 7 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -5.2%) sinks after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.59/share, down from $0.90 in the...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -5.2%) sinks after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.59/share, down from $0.90 in the year-ago period and $0.97 analyst consensus. Revenues fell 6.5% Y/Y to $2.23B vs. $2.53B consensus. Gold and copper production down 3% and 10% Y/Y respectively. NEM lowers 2012 gold production outlook to 5M-5.1M oz., cuts outlook for capital expenditures to $2.7B-$3B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • QLGC

    QLogic (QLGC -21.2%) crashes after missing FQ1 estimates, and guiding on its earnings call for...

    QLogic (QLGC -21.2%) crashes after missing FQ1 estimates, and guiding on its earnings call for revenue of $115M-$120M and EPS of $0.16-$0.20, well below a consensus of $138.6M and $0.30. QLogic blames weak server sales, something that hurts demand for its storage adapter cards, as well as (unsurprisingly) macro issues. But the fact QLogic also missed top-line estimates in May suggests some of its problems are company-specific. Archrival ELX -6.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +25.2%) takes off on new rumors Seagate (STX -0.5%) is looking to buy the...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +25.2%) takes off on new rumors Seagate (STX -0.5%) is looking to buy the company (previous) to shore up its solid-state drive position. This time around, it's reported Seagate is offering to pay ~$1B - $475M-$550M in cash and $450M-$525M in stock - or more than twice what OCZ is worth even after today's move. Some clearly doubt Seagate would pay that much. Rival STEC is up 3.1% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -29.2%) plummets at the open on a report that bondholders are organizing...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -29.2%) plummets at the open on a report that bondholders are organizing a group to represent their interests in a potential restructuring. ATPG has been battered by production delays, missed output targets and a cash crunch that jeopardized its ability to cover debt payments.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -13.2%) plunges after meeting lowballed estimates, but reporting major slowdowns in...

    Facebook (FB -13.2%) plunges after meeting lowballed estimates, but reporting major slowdowns in Payments growth, Western user growth, and U.S. ad impressions, as well as huge spending hikes. The ad impression drop is fueling concerns the shift to mobile is doing more damage than thought. Analysts are mostly staying positive: Needham expects mobile monetization to improve as advertisers get more comfortable with the platform. ZNGA -2.7%. LNKD -4.7%. RENN -3.1%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 3 Comments
  • MNI

    McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI): Q2 EPS of $0.31. Revenue of $299.3M (-4.8% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares...

    McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI): Q2 EPS of $0.31. Revenue of $299.3M (-4.8% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +19% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • AUTH

    Premarket gainers: AUTH +60%. OCZ +29%. MNI +19%. STEM +18%. SIMO +17%. ACI +14%. EXPE +14%. KKR...

    Premarket gainers: AUTH +60%. OCZ +29%. MNI +19%. STEM +18%. SIMO +17%. ACI +14%. EXPE +14%. KKR +10%. DECK +9%. BCS +7%. PWER +7%. JRCC +6%. ANR +5%.
    Losers: GDOT -57%. ATPG -32%. APKT -18%. NTGR -17%. FB -16%. CSTR -14%. SBUX -10%. HZNP -8%. LOGI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) declares C$0.06/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record...

    Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) declares C$0.06/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record Aug 10. Payable Aug 24. Ex-div date Aug 08. Shares -1.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems (QSII) declares $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    Quality Systems (QSII) declares $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 4.39%. For shareholders of record Sep 14. Payable Oct 05. Ex-div date Sep 12. Shares +1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • DHI

    D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) declares $0.0375/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) declares $0.0375/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 0.80%. For shareholders of record Aug 13. Payable Aug 24. Ex-div date Aug 09. Shares +1.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • SSB

    SCBT Financial (SCBT) declares $0.17/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    SCBT Financial (SCBT) declares $0.17/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 1.89%. For shareholders of record Aug 17. Payable Aug 24. Ex-div date Aug 15. Shares +2.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM

  • Stock futures don't show too much reaction to falling GDP growth, which comes in above...

    Stock futures don't show too much reaction to falling GDP growth, which comes in above forecasts. S&P +0.3%, Nasdaq +0.4%, Dow +0.45%. The dollar climbs vs. euro, which is now flat at $1.2281 after being at $1.2327.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARCH

    More on Arch Coal's (NYSE:ACI) Q2: Reaffirms thermal coal sales volume forecast of 128M-134M...

    More on Arch Coal's (NYSE:ACI) Q2: Reaffirms thermal coal sales volume forecast of 128M-134M tons, while lowering its met coal forecast to 7.5M tons vs. previous 8M-8.5M. ACI +11.6% premarket; other coal names moving higher: ANR +4.5%, JRCC +2.3%, BTU +1.9%, WLT +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 4 Comments

  • EU shares have turned solidly green following speculation of possible co-ordinated bond-buying...

    EU shares have turned solidly green following speculation of possible co-ordinated bond-buying action by the ECB and eurozone. EU STOXX 50 +1.1%, London +0.1%, Paris +1.3%, Frankfurt +0.2%, Madrid +1.05%, Milan +1.9%. Spanish 10-year bond yields -8 bps to 6.84%. Italy +1.5 bps to 6.07%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • KKR

    KKR (NYSE:KKR): Q2 EPS of $0.74 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.16. Revenue of $112.3M...

    KKR (NYSE:KKR): Q2 EPS of $0.74 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.16. Revenue of $112.3M (-4% Y/Y) misses by $78M. Shares +1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM

  • EU shares are mixed as the Draghi effect begins to peter out, although not in Spain, where...

    EU shares are mixed as the Draghi effect begins to peter out, although not in Spain, where stocks are +0.5% and 10-year bond yields are -9 bps at 6.84%. Bastion's Adrian Slack injects a bit of realism into proceedings. "He's (Draghi) got to do it within the framework of the European Union, and it hasn't worked so far," Slack says. Euro STOXX 50 -0.1%, London -0.1%, Paris flat, Frankfurt -0.3%, Milan +0.5%.
